Evanston 1st Liquors.Description: Evanston 1st Liquors, or "EV1", is one of Evanston’s most popular liquor stores. They have a huge selection of alcoholic beverages– from wine to craft beers to tasty mixers. The store is also conveniently located in front of Cozy Noodles & Rice, which is a yummy BYOB restaurant. Stop by Evanston 1st to grab a nice bottle of wine before going to dinner. Must be 21+.

Vinic Wine Co.Description: Vinic Wine is a great way to meet quality wines. They offer two tastings a week and they also have an online shop. Vinic is a super useful place to visit before a date— they’ll give you recommendations of food that pairs well with a specific wine you choose. Must be 21+.

Patisserie Coralie.Description: This is Evanston’s very own boutique French bakery. This place offers amazing french pastries— perfectly paired with a cup of coffee. All their furniture is custom made to get the perfect French cafe vibe.They also take pride in using high quality natural ingredients to bake their goods. Good news: they have online delivery and also cater for events. Bon appetit!

Ruby Nails.Description: Here you can find manicures, pedicures and waxing services. They also close their salon for events, which is a great opportunity to treat yourself with friends while helping a local business.

Eye See Beauty.Description: Here you can find a stylist specializing in growing healthy hair. You can find a lot of different services here, spanning from coloring to haircuts to treatments and styling. This is also a place specialized in natural hair.

Blissful Nail Spa.Description: This place truly is a bliss for your nails. This is an amazing option for pedicures, manicures and massages. This is a great option if you’re looking for nail art or any other extraordinary nail style. Good news: Monday through Thursday they offer $20 off for first time guests!

Salon Roula.Description: You can visit Salon Roula for a variety of cuts and other hair services. They work with three high-quality product lines: Moroccanoil, Aquage and Biolage. They also offer discounts to Northwestern students— just bring your wildcard!

Smile Suite.Description: Smile Suite specializes in their "orthodontic facelift", which uses orthodontic techniques to view your face features holistically. They’re proud to offer flexible finances, including free consultations, so that everyone can have access to their care. Smile Suite is owned by Kimerly Smith, one of nine Black orthodontists in Illinois. She’s proud of employing a diverse group of staff and making her treatments accessible and safe. Smile Suite offers student discounts!

Glantz Design.Description: Glantz Design is Evanston’s very own design studio. They often design for local businesses and focus on creating a strategy-driven approach that is both practical and aesthetically pleasing. They often partner with Northwestern to offer internship opportunities through CFS.

The Threading Spot Eyebrow Bar.Description: The Threading Spot offers one of Evanston’s cheapest waxing and threading services. They’re super quick and don’t require any appointments. Perfect for when you’re in a rush and need a high-quality service. They also do classic Indian henna tattoos!

Salon Texture.Description: Salon Texture give you treatments that fit your lifestyle, facial features and natural hair texture. They offer both male and female haircuts and take pride in offering modern styles and techniques. They also offer curling lessons!

Berry Pike Cafe.Description: Berry Pike Cafe has so many options, ranging from freshly made waffles, fresh fruit smoothies, steamed bagel sandwiches, coffee from Guatemala and much more. They have both vegan and vegetarian bagel sandwiches!

Cupitol.Description: Cupitol is one of Evanston’s most beloved brunch spots. They have an in-house bakery and offer a wide selection of sandwiches, salads, soups and more. They also have an amazing option of cocktails! (21+)

Al’s Deli.Description: Al’s Deli is an Evanston staple. They offer French sandwiches, soups and deli meat for a great price. Try their buttercream cookies! They also have several vegetarian options.

Bagel Art Cafe.Description: Bagel Art is famous for… you guessed it... their bagel sandwiches! They take pride in keeping things simple, but with a refined taste. They also offer catering services!

Buffalo Joe’s.Description: Buffalo Joe’s is famous for their delicious wings— and you can smell it from miles away! They’re served hot and buttery with celery sticks and ranch. Besides their wings, they also offer sandwiches, burgers, beef, baked potatoes, salads and much more. Call ahead to order in-store pick ups.

Na Korn.Description: Na Korn is an urban Thai restaurant. They offer super tasty dishes with an interesting modern Thai decor. During COVID-19, they’re offering outdoor dining options in heated bubble tents and at-home meal kits. They also donate to "Put a Fork In Hunger" and welcome any donations.

Kansaku.Description: Kansaku is one of Evanston’s top sushi spots. They often offer high-quality fish, such as Bluefin Tuna, Tu Toro and O Toro. They also cater to events with pre-fixed menus, buffet options and more.

Amanda Evanston Freund Studio and Galler.Description: Amanda is an Evanstonian painter and designer. Check out her gallery to see an artist doing what she loves. This is a great option if you’re looking to hang up some original artwork on your wall. She also offers online painting courses and in-person art classes!

American Toby Jug Museum.Description: Visiting this museum is definitely a different type of activity! But did you know Evanston houses America’s largest collection of Toby and character jugs? They also offer free admission and tours.

Smylie Brothers Brewing Co.Description: This is a family-owned craft brewery and smokehouse. They have an outstanding outdoor seating area— perfect for those warmer days.

The Barn Steakhouse.Description: The Barn is a delicious Evanston steakhouse offering high-quality Heritage Angus Beef and other carefully selected ingredients. During COVID-19, they’re offering dining in tents.

Viet Nom Nom.Description: This is Evanston’s very own Vietnamese restaurant. They offer baos to combo meals to yummy orange chicken for a great price.

Foot Smile Spa.Description: This is a great place to get amazing massages for an affordable price. Foot Smile boasts of reflexology experts who are certain to make you relax after a long day.

Taco Diablo.Description: Taco Diablo is an Evanston staple! They’re famous for their Taco Tuesdays and "Yes, please!" cocktail (21+). You can find great Mexican food with a lovely atmosphere.

Five & Dime.Description: Five & Dime is an Evanston favorite. They offer an amazing array of food and cocktails with an outstanding outdoor dining area with fairy lights. A great spot for a date or a nice dinner with friends!

Cozy Noodles & Rice.Description: Cozy Noodles & Rice offers yummy Asian food at a great price. It’s also BYOB. The atmosphere is pretty fun— the place is covered in license plates from all over the country and even features a life-sized Elvis statue!

D&D's Finer Foods.Description: Established in 1973, D&D’s is a family-owned mom and pop convenience store offering deli options, alcoholic beverages, regular groceries and other yummy snacks. Working with local vendors, they offer hormone and steroid free meat and poultry. They offer same-day delivery and if unavailable, they’ll give you a next-day guarantee!

Campus Gear.Description: Campus Gear has offered Northwestern University apparel since 1992— it’s an Evanston landmark. You can find everything Northwestern here— from sweaters to pijamas to baseball hats to dog gear. We recommend visiting Campus Gear if you’re looking to up your game with school spirit! Check out their website for discounts. Go Cats!

Gigi Bottega.Description: This is a modern boutique with vintage style. Originally from Bloomington, IL, they also have an Evanston location. Find cute sweaters, stylish boots, dainty jewelry and even scented candles! They also offer free shipping on online orders over $25.

The Mexican Shop.Description: The Mexican Shop opened in 1967 and they’re still offering a funky selection of vintage clothes, shoes and accessories. If you’re looking for some bohemian outfits— this is the place for you. Fun fact: they have a wig section!

Beck’s Book Store.Description: Beck’s Book Store sells and rents first-hand and second-hand books. If you’re a Northwestern student, this is a great place to find your class textbooks for lower prices. What’s more, you can rent a book and get part of your money back when you return it! They also have a cool variety of Northwestern apparel. You can also order books online and select in-store pick up or delivery.

Quartet Digital Printing.Description: Quartet Digital Printing has been open for 33 years, offering the Evanston community a range of printing and copying services. If you’re a Northwestern student, you’ll find that a lot of your professors ask you to pick up printed textbooks from them— that’s because they’re great! Visit this store if you need any help printing or copying in small or large quantities.

Ayla’s Originals.Description: Ayla’s originals is a family-owned shop selling beads and artist-designed jewelry. Fun fact: they offer classes where you can design your own accessory! This is a great place to find cool material to make your own arts and crafts at home. They also have an Etsy store worth checking out! Ayla’s Originals offers 1:1 appointments— call to make an appointment or book a class.

Saville Flowers.Description: Saville Flowers is a family-owned store established in 1942. Still in its original location, Saville Flowers offers classic European floral designs. Owner Mark Jones grew up working at the store with his parents, who instilled in him a passion for customer care and community involvement. He’s passionate about celebrating important events in Evanstonian lives, such as weddings, anniversaries, birthdays, graduations and more. If you’re looking for a special gift or a nice touch to your apartment, stop by Saville Flowers!

Tealicious.Description: Tealicious brings Taiwanese flavors to Evanston. Here you can find delicious bubble teas, waffles, shaved ice and bento boxes. Tealicious is dedicated to providing healthy bubble tea using high-quality imported tea leaves. They also offer fresh milk and pure cane sugar, and their tapioca is handmade!

June’s Alterations and Cleaners.Description: With over 20 years of experience, June’s Alterations and Cleaners provide custom and expert tailoring and repairs on wedding apparel, leathers, zippers, knits, delicate fabrics and more. This is considered an affordable and quick option for those looking to get perfectly fitted clothes. Make sure to check them out!

Best Care (BC) Dry Cleaners.Description: For over a decade, BC Dry Cleaners specializes in wet cleaning and alterations. Wet cleaning is a safe method of dry cleaning that doesn’t use petrochemicals. The best part is that virtually any item can be wet cleaned! BC Cleaners works with regular clothing, leather and suede, household items and even shoes. They also do your laundry and fold them!

Steven Papageorge Salon.Description: Steven Papageorge is one of Evanston’s most beloved salons. They’ve been offering Evanston residents hair cuts, hair coloring, highlighting, teasylighting, babylighting, balayaging, color-corrections, waxing and facials for over 36 years! Definitely check them out if you want to update your look. Northwestern students get discounts! During COVID-19, they’re offering full hair blow outs on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays. Full blow outs are also available on Saturdays from 10 am to 12:30 pm on Wednesdays.

Noyes Street Barber Shop.Description: Established in 1915, Noyes Street Barber Shop offers Evanstonians haircuts for a good price. The owner’s grandfather, Fred Booge, started working at the barbershop in 1953. Booge and his partner, Otmar, ran the shop in the 70s and 80s. The store was passed on to Booge’s son in the 90s. Fun fact: the owner’s father has cut over 250,000 heads of hair in his career! They’re proud of keeping the standards of their past, but with a modern twist. Neck shaves are included with each hair cut. They also trim beards and moustaches.

Salon Antou.Description: Salon Antou employs professionally trained and experienced stylists, and carries top-line hair and coloring products from Aveda.

Chiropractic First.Description: Chiropractic First offers a very specific type of light touch chiropractic care that helps people feel less anxious, more peaceful, and more focused. They are proud to be one of only a few chiropractic offices in the Midwest who offer these specific services.

Beacon Academy.Description: High schools haven’t changed much in the past century, and yet the skills that students need to contribute to an ever-changing world have evolved radically. At Beacon, high school education is re-imagined with an innovative curriculum that is challenging, rigorous, engaging, and creative. Students learn how to think for themselves, collaborate and work in teams, and interact with the outside world by working on authentic problems.

Dempster Auto Rebuilders, Inc..Description: Dempster Auto Rebuilders has been family owned and operated for over 60 years, and are recognized as one of the top 10 collision repair shops in the Chicago area by Consumer Checkbook Magazine. They are Evanston's oldest, independently owned repair facility. After hours appointments are available in the evenings and on weekends as schedules permit.

Nature's Perspective Landscaping, Inc..Description: Founded by a husband and wife team, Nature’s Perspective Landscaping is a full service landscaping firm with 42 years of history behind it. This business works with you, the client, to create functional and aesthetically pleasing landscaping solutions.

Orthodontics By The Lake.Description: Orthodontics By The Lake is a family-friendly clinic that practices the highest level of orthodontic care. Dr. Barry Walvoord’s mission is to not only help his patients obtain a balanced bite, but to improve their lives as well.

Dance Center Evanston.Description: By promoting personal and physical growth in a challenging yet positive environment, Dance Center Evanston fosters lifelong technical and mental acuity for dancers of all ages.

Evanston Lumber.Description: Founded in 1948 by Eli Fisher, Evanston Lumber carries a line of quality building products and provides outstanding service in projects such as home additions and construction. This is a multilingual company, with employees speaking English, Spanish, and Polish.

Edzo's Burger Shop.Description: Edzo’s is a local burger joint known for its classic burger and fries.

Dave’s New Kitchen.Description: Dave’s New Kitchen is an Evanston favorite. From customizable pasta dishes to homemade pizza, Dave’s offers comforting food for reasonable prices.

Tomate Fresh Kitchen.Description: A variety of burritos and tacos served in a cozy but iconic restaurant.

Soban Korea.Description: Authentic Korean restaurant with healthy and satisfying dishes.

Peppercorns Kitchen.Description: Peppercorns Kitchen offers authentic Chinese Sichuan dishes with options for lunch combos.

10Q Chicken.Description: Opened by 2 childhood friends obsessed with fried chicken, 10Q offers American fried chicken classics with an East Asian twist.

Bookends & Beginnings.Description: Bookends & Beginnings is an independent bookstore opened by a husband and wife duo.

Pono Ono.Description: Pono Ono is a Hawaiian cafe specializing in seasoned raw fish bowls and pressed juice.

Coffee Lab Evanston.Description: Coffee Lab is the go-to place for Northwestern University students. Known for their fresh roasted specialty coffee, Coffee Lab also offers a selection of Asian inspired pastries.

Backlot Coffee.Description: Backlot Coffee is a neighborhood coffee house that offers home-roasted coffee options.

Accents Plus.Description: Accents Plus is a local boutique carrying a wide range of contemporary and European apparel.

Alley Gallery.Description: Drop off your artwork at Alley Gallery for a custom frame! With over 75 years of combined custom framing experience, this independently-owned store offers top-notch craftsmanship with museum quality materials.

Bloom 3.Description: Order custom flower arrangements or send them to a loved one with Bloom 3, an independently owned flower shop.

Celtic Knot Public House.Description: Celtic Knot is a modern Irish pub offering pub grub, craft brews, and exceptional entrees.

Koi Fine Asian Cuisine & Lounge.Description: Covering 8 distinct regional Chinese cuisines and sushi, Koi Fine Asian Cuisine & Lounge is one of Evanston’s oldest Asian restaurants. They also give back to their community by donating tasty meals to the homeless every Thursday and giving 23% of their gross profit to local organizations every month.

Story.storySlide1: Koi Fine Asian Cuisine & Lounge is one of Evanston’s oldest Asian restaurants and they take pride in giving back to the community that has supported them for almost 2 decades. We interviewed their owner to get the inside scoop! Let’s see what we learned —
Story.storySlide2: Owner Sandy Chen has organized Koi’s menu into 8 distinct regional Chinese cuisines so customers can learn the history behind their dish. Customers can also book sushi and dumpling-making classes to immerse themselves in Asian cooking. Alongside preparing delicious food, Koi promotes cultural education through cuisine so that customers can get the complete experience.
Story.storySlide3: Koi proudly participates in the Table 23 charity program by donating 23% of their gross profit to local organizations. With a new partner each month, Koi supports Evanstonians through mental health programs, arts empowerment, and everything in between. They also donate their tasty meals to the homeless every Thursday! “We give back to the community,” says owner Sandy Chen. “We think that the whole community of Evanston is a big family.”

La Cocinita.Description: From tacos and arepas, La Cocinita is a Venezuelan restaurant with a twist. Since March 2020, La Cocinta has fed over 7,000 frontline workers and people in need.

YoFresh Yogurt Cafe.Description: YoFresh is a cafe that offers coffee, pastries, smoothies, light meals, and 86 exceptional yogurt flavors that appear seasonally.

Taste of Jamaica.Description: Visit Taste of Jamaica for authentic Jamaican dishes like jerk chicken, oxtail, jerk catfish, and curry goat.

Ovo Frito Cafe.Description: Ovo Frito offers breakfast, lunch and brunch options with a friendly atmosphere.

Jennifer’s Edible.Description: With ingredients sourced from local farmer markets, Jennifer’s Edibles offers a wide selection of authentic Jamaican food.

Hecky’s Barbecue.Description: Serving the Evanston community since 1983, Hecky’s is famous for their barbecue ribs and chicken.

Minouchic Boutique.Description: Minouchic Boutique specializes in African style clothing, jewelry, and art, while featuring new, resale, and vintage products.

Frontline North.Description: Frontline North is a Black-owned variety store that carries products spanning books, cultural apparel, natural body & hair care products, jewelry, and art.

Classy Closet Consignment.Description: Serving the Evanston community for over 10 years, Classy Closet Consignment is a local, Black-owned resale shop. Visit Classy Closet Consignment to shop the latest vintage fashion.

Stepping Out on Faith Consignment Shop.Description: Stepping Out on Faith Consignment Shop is a second hand store that specializes in designer and vintage clothing.

C&W Market and Ice Cream Parlor.Description: C&W Market and Ice Cream Parlor is a grocery, produce, and ice cream store all in one. Owners Clarence and Wendy are heavily involved in the Evanston community, providing free grocery deliveries for local senior citizens and community members in need.
C&W Market and Ice Cream Parlor.Subheading: Grocery Store and Ice Cream Parlor

Prairie Moon.Description: Prairie Moon offers regional American cuisine such as Pine-Nut Trout, Po’Boys Brick Chicken, and Crawfish Etouffee in a fun and welcoming atmosphere.

Cross-Rhodes.Description: Local staple serving gyros, pitas & other Greek grub in a tiny, no-frills space known for its fries and and "Chicken Greek Style" served in a unique white wine, lemon and herb sauce. Cross Rhodes supports shelters and soup kitchens and welcomes donations.
